ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.

What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
- presentation skills
- consulting skills
- teamwork
- leadership
- literature review writing
- survey creating
Working on an actual case for youth in Angola, very cool project, get to interact a ton with your teammates and build something from the scratch

I learned a lot about NCDs prevention, causal linkages, and how to engage youth, especially in Angola, in NCDs prevention. I further developed crucial skills in working with clients, creating a workplan, adapting to difficult situations, and developing deliverables like a Literature Review, Causality Analysis, Strategy Plan, and Advocacy Campaign and Dissemination.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths
- professor very engaged 
- lots of freedom to craft our own project
- amazing group of people
- sense of purpose
- very interesting topics


Weakness
- a lot of work
- not very good communication
- felt a little scattered sometimes
It is tough to do the class online and you really miss out on the opportunity to travel to Angola

This course was really interesting, and strengths include the large amount of material and progress you cover in just one semester and the ability to work with wonderful clients and gain that exposure. Weaknesses included that working in a group is made difficult in a pandemic setting, and it was sometimes unclear what the timeline or expected tasks were for the team and for different individuals.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Very well adapted to online learning. No feedback, other than great virtual class.
I think Jackson and the Prof. Alipui did their best in creating an engaging space

We had a lot of presentations, which was helpful to remain engaged and learn from each other virtually. However, these presentations sometimes took away from our ability to work on the main deliverables and tasks of the course, which left us overwhelmed at the end of the term.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes. Just make sure you speak with the Professor a lot and get clarity on stuff. He makes himself available for extra office hours- go to them early and often. They clear things up a lot.
Yes, definitely. Dr. Alipui is amazing.
This is a major requirement, but I would recommend Dr. Alipui's capstone to other students! Just be prepared to dedicate a lot of effort to the course, which is time-consuming but very rewarding!
